New Records: The pair of Alex Hales and Jos Buttler put on the highest-ever partnership in T20 World Cups.
This was also England's highest opening stand in T20 cricket and the nation's second-largest union for any wicket in the shortest format.
Key Match Events: Alex Hales scored 86 not out from 47 balls.
Jos Buttler scored 80 not out from 49 balls.
Hardik Pandya scored 63 from 33 balls with five sixes.
Virat Kohli made his fourth half-century from six knocks in the tournament, scoring 50 from 40 balls.
England chased down 169 runs to win with 24 balls to spare.
Chris Jordan took 3 wickets for 43 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed pride in the team's performance, calling it their best performance so far.
Rohit Sharma expressed disappointment in India's performance, particularly with their bowling.
Alex Hales reflected on the special feeling of playing in a World Cup again and called the match one of the best nights of his career.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Adelaide Oval.
England will face Pakistan in the final at the MCG.
Chris Jordan replaced Mark Wood due to stiffness, and Phil Salt replaced Dawid Malan due to a groin injury.
